description: doc: various "the the" and other typos

messages.text:
My script was:

grep -r "the the " *

I was reading through an article, saw "the the", and fixed just that. If
you have a real script that found others, please proceed yourself.

On Sat, Jul 7, 2012 at 11:35 PM, dga <dave.andersen@gmail.com> wrote:

> (To be clear - I was just listing a few;  there are actually quite a few
> more remaining than I listed below)
>
>   -Dave
>
>
> On Saturday, July 7, 2012 11:35:02 PM UTC-4, dga wrote:
>>
>> Hi, Matt - I did some quick runs through the code and observed that there
>> are still a bunch of doubled words in comments in sub-directories of
>> packages.
>>
>> go/doc/reader.go,
>> html/template/url.go
>>
>> And one accidentally doubled word in actual code in x508/verify.go:
>>
>> -               return "x509: certificate is not authorized to sign other
>> other certificates"
>> +               return "x509: certificate is not authorized to sign other
>> certificates"
>>
>> (I'm guessing the script you used only went one level deep inside
>> src/pkg.)
>>
>> I've tweaked some of those in my tree, but since it was your (good!) idea
>> to scan for this kind of error, I figured I'd point it out if you want to
>> submit the changes.  If not, LMK and I'll submit a second CL that fixes
>> some more of these.
>>
>>   -Dave
>>
>>>
>>>

Please fill out the CLA so that I can accept your contribution:

http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html#copyright

(To be clear - I was just listing a few;  there are actually quite a few 
more remaining than I listed below)

  -Dave

On Saturday, July 7, 2012 11:35:02 PM UTC-4, dga wrote:
>
> Hi, Matt - I did some quick runs through the code and observed that there 
> are still a bunch of doubled words in comments in sub-directories of 
> packages.
>
> go/doc/reader.go,
> html/template/url.go
>
> And one accidentally doubled word in actual code in x508/verify.go:
>
> -               return "x509: certificate is not authorized to sign other 
> other certificates"
> +               return "x509: certificate is not authorized to sign other 
> certificates"
>
> (I'm guessing the script you used only went one level deep inside src/pkg.)
>
> I've tweaked some of those in my tree, but since it was your (good!) idea 
> to scan for this kind of error, I figured I'd point it out if you want to 
> submit the changes.  If not, LMK and I'll submit a second CL that fixes 
> some more of these.
>
>   -Dave
>
>>
>>

On 2012/07/07 18:55:53, adg wrote:
> Please fill out the CLA so that I can accept your contribution:
> 
> http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html#copyright

I did that yesterday. Did it not process?

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

Hi, Matt - I did some quick runs through the code and observed that there 
are still a bunch of doubled words in comments in sub-directories of 
packages.

go/doc/reader.go,
html/template/url.go

And one accidentally doubled word in actual code in x508/verify.go:

-               return "x509: certificate is not authorized to sign other 
other certificates"
+               return "x509: certificate is not authorized to sign other 
certificates"

(I'm guessing the script you used only went one level deep inside src/pkg.)

I've tweaked some of those in my tree, but since it was your (good!) idea 
to scan for this kind of error, I figured I'd point it out if you want to 
submit the changes.  If not, LMK and I'll submit a second CL that fixes 
some more of these.

  -Dave


On Saturday, July 7, 2012 3:17:44 PM UTC-4, Matt Jibson wrote:
>
> On 2012/07/07 18:55:53, adg wrote: 
> > Please fill out the CLA so that I can accept your contribution: 
>
> > http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html#copyright 
>
> I did that yesterday. Did it not process? 
>
> http://codereview.appspot.com/6355076/ 
>
